post_text:
Hello friends!! I’m back for a new Friday Feature at Concord & 9th!! This week we are featuring a bunch of incredible products from the recent release, starting off with the super fun Triangle Confetti Turnabout Stamp and the Triangle Confetti Dies.

To create this card I first stamped the background with the Triangle Confetti Turnabout Stamp in Honeysuckle, Marmalade, Buttercup and Oceanside onto an A2 panel of Ballet Slipper cardstock. When I finished stamping the background I then die cut a circle with the Triangle Confetti Die. I then die cut an A2 panel of craft foam with the same circle die using the previous panel as a guide. I then adhered the craft foam panel to the front of an A2 Honeysuckle top-folding card base to create a well.

Next I die cut triangle confetti out of Ballet Slipper, Buttercup, Marmalade and Oceanside cardstocks. I then added the confetti to the well and then adhered an acetate panel to the triangle turnabout panel and then adhered the panel to the card front. Next, I adhered black and white twine to the card front and then fussy cut a balloon end out of Honeysuckle cardstock and adhered it to the card.

I then die cut three layers of “hooray” out of white cardstock and then adhered the layers together. I then adhered the letters onto the balloon. Next, I stamped and white heat-embossed a sub-sentiment using a sentiment from the Triangle Confetti Turnabout stamp set onto black cardstock. I then trimmed the sentiment down to a strip and adhered the strip to the card front.

My next card features the Sweet Summer Stamp Set, Sweet Summer Stencil Pack and Sweet Summer Dies.

To create this card I first die cut popsicles out of Ballet Slipper and Buttercup cardstocks using the Sweet Summer Dies. I then ink blended details onto the popsicles using the Sweet Summer Stencil Pack in Honeysuckle and Marmalade ink.

I then ink blended the bottom with the same inks as well and then fussy cut a couple highlights out of white cardstock and then adhered them to the popsicles. Next, I die cut popsicle sticks out of wheat cardstock and adhered them to the backside of the popsicles. I then stamped and white heat-embossed a sentiment onto the front of the Aqua Sky A2 top-folding card base.

Next I ink blended the card front with Oceanside ink and then splattered it with white watercolor paint. Lastly I finished the card by adhering the popsicles to the card front with foam adhesive.

My last card features the fun Just Amazing Dies!

To create this card I first stamped and white heat-embossed a background with the Triangle Confetti onto the front of an A2 top-folding white card base. I then ink blending with Honeysuckle, Marmalade, Buttercup and Aqua Sky ink.

I then die cut my sentiment out of mirrored and white cardstocks. I then inlaid the white letters into the mirrored cardstock frame. Next, I die cut a shadow layer out of vellum and then adhered the letters to the shadow layer with foam adhesive. Lastly I finished the card by adhering the sentiment to the card front with foam adhesive.

I hope you enjoyed my cards. Thank you so much for stopping by!!

~Channin

Share this:

  • Share
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Email

post_title: VIDEO: Layered Sunflowers with Copic Details
post_text:
Hello friends!! Today I’m sharing a card and video I created with the Layered Sunflowers Combo from Waffle Flower Crafts. Watch to learn a trick for stamping two layered floral groupings at once as well as see how I personalize these images by adding copic details.

Layered Sunflowers with Copic Details

Watch below or on my YouTube channel.

I hope you enjoyed my card and video! Thanks so much for stopping by!

~Channin

Hello crafty friends!! I have a new video to share!! In today’s video I watercolored the beautiful poinsettias from Waffle Flower Crafts Poinsettia Stamp Set using Tombow Dual Brush Pens. These markers and the resist of the gold embossing makes coloring these flowers super easy!

Easy Watercolored Poinsettias

Watch below or on my YouTube channel.

post_text:
Hello all!! Today is the day!! It’s release day! I’m so jazzed to be a part of a Waffle Flower Crafts December Release Blog Hop!

Though this release may not be as big as some in the past it’s still pretty fantastic and as the norm I have a video and a ton of cards to share with you all!!

First let’s take a look at the Cookie Love Combo! This adorable set was illustrated by the critter lovers favorite, Big Bear and Bird!

I used the Cookie Love Stamp Set to create this fun Peek-a-boo Flip card! I also have a video showing the how process.

Cookie Love Peek-a-Boo Flip Card

Watch below or on my YouTube channel.

post_text:
Hello everyone!! There’s a new fantastic challenge over at CAS-ual Fridays!! The new theme is absolutely awesome, one of my favs, one layer cards!!!


I love one layer cards!! One layer cards typically become CAS cards which is my absolute favorite style and what I often strive for. But don’t get me wrong they are definitely a bit of a challenge, but when it works out it’s magic!! Okay so here’s what I came up with.


First I stamped and clear embossed my sentiment which is from the Shenanigans Stamp Set. Then I repeatedly stamped a stamp from the Zigs & Zags Stamp Set in blues and greens under the sentiment. Next, I drew the wick with a permanent marker. 


Then I stamped the flame in yellow and orange ink using the Wallflower Stamp Set. Next, I repeatly stamped the stamp from the Zigs & Zags Stamp Set again but this time above the sentiment. Lastly, I finished off the card with more wicks and flames. 

I hope you enjoyed and have a wonderful day! 

~Channin

  • Share
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Email

post_text:
Hello everyone!! I’m here with some inspiration for the new challenge at CAS-ual Fridays Challenge Blog!! The new theme this week is very fitting for the upcoming holiday! 


Pretty perfect huh! And here’s what I came up with.


First I repeatedly stamped the flowers and leaves from the Pretty Posies Stamp Set in red on a 5×7 panel of pink card stock. I then adhered my pink panel to my card base made from red cardstock. I then stamped the several of the same flowers and leaves on white cardstock and then colored only the flowers in with some alcohol markers (I mostly used my new Ohuhu markers and I we have a review on these in the near future). 


After my coloring was complete I die cut all my images out using the Posies Fri-Die. I then adhered the leaves and some of flowers directly onto the panel and the remaining flowers I attached with foam tape to added depth. Lastly, I stamped and white embossed the sentiment from the Love Notes Stamp Set on a strip of black cardstock and adhered it to the card front with foam tape. 

I hope enjoyed and with give this challenge at try! Thanks for stopping by!

~Channin

post_title: Waffle Flower 2017 Winter Release!! Available TODAY!!
post_text:
Hello everyone!! Sorry I’ve been seemingly MIA but I have been very very busy creating some fun cards for Waffle Flower’s Winter 2017 Release! 

This release is epic!! Two amazingly talented designers, Helen Dardik and Big Bear & Bird,  designed some pretty amazing sets for this release!! 

Today I’m going to share some of the cards that I made from the sets designed by Helen Dardik. 

First up is the Enveloper Hello Stamp Set!


First I stamped all the images and sentiment in dark blue dye ink one watercolor paper. I then simply used water and a brush to re activate the ink and painted over all the images. 


Simple but so beautiful! I was greatly inspired by Helen Dardik’s work. 

 Here’s another one using the awesome Enveloper Hello Stamp Set! For this one I simply stamped the images on a rectangle cut using the Pinking Layer Dies in memento tuxedo black then copic colored them. 
Next up is Enveloper OK Stamp Set!


For this I also stamped the floral images on a 5″x 7″ panel in memento tuxedo black. I then masked a small section and stamped the girl. I then copic colored everything. Lastly I stamped the sentiment on a scrap of white, drew a speech bubble around it, fussy cut it, and adhered it with foam tape. 

Next up is the Enveloper Choice Stamp Set! 


This set is awesome because it come with a two cute animals, a lion and a cat! First I stamped and embossed the lion in gold on watercolor paper. Then I colored the lion in using watered down Waffle Flower Dye Inks (Oh Happy Day, My Pleasure, and Peace of Mind). I then cut a scalloped circle using the Flower Circle Inverted Dies from a 5″ x 7″ panel of emerald cardstock. I then trimmed down the lion adhered it to the card base, then adhered the panel and the scalloped circle with craft foam. Lastly, I stamped and gold embossed the sentiment then trimmed it down and adhered it to my card front. 


For next card I used the cute kitty from Enveloper Choice Stamp Set. I stamped her and the sentiment in brown ink on a kraft rectangle cut using the Pinking Layer Dies. I then colored her with my copics and added some Wink of Stella to her cheeks. 

Ok next up is the Enveloper Birthday Stamp Set!

 

First I ink blended a rainbow using Waffle Flower inks on a couple of rectangle scraps. I then stamped images and the sentiment from the Enveloper Birthday Stamp Set in Versafine Onyx Black ink over the rainbow ink blending. I then adhered the rectangles into my 5″ x 7″ cardbase and trimmed off the excess. Lastly, I created frames using the Lacy Layer 2 Dies and adhered them and then trimmed off the overhang. 


For this card I stamped and white embossed the cute girl and some of the flowers on water color paper. Then I watered colored over the embossing using watered down Waffle Flower dye inks. I then cut it the water colored panel and stamped and white embossed the sentiment on a strip of black cardstock. I then adhered the sentiment strip to my card base and then adhered my split and trimmed watercolored panel to the my card base with craft foam. 

Next up is the Enveloper Kindness Stamp Set. 


For this card stamped the floral image a 3 times at various heights on white cardstock to create a border. I then colored the images in with my copics and fussy cut them out. Next I stamped the bear image on my card base and colored him in with my copics a well. 


I then stamped my sentiment and then adhered my floral border into my card base using foam tape and then adhered a strip of pattern paper at the base. 

Ok last stamp set, Enveloper Little Birdie, thanks for sticking along with me! 


First I stamped the gorgeous bird and floral border and a sentiment on my kraft 5″ x 7″ card base in Versafine Onyx Black. I then stamped the image again on white cardstock in Memento Tuxedo Black and copic colored the birds and then fussy cut them out. Lastly I adhered the birds with some foam tape onto my card.

I hope you enjoyed! Tomorrow I share some more of my creations from this awesome release! And everything I’ve shown you today  is available now, yes right now! So check it all out at Waffle Flower Crafts! 

Thanks for stopping by and have a wonderful day!!

~Channin

Share this:

  • Share
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Email

post_text:
Hello everyone!! Today I am so happy to be participating in the Calling All Sistahs May Blog Hop! After Michele Gross of CAS-ual Fridays StampsÂ was diagnosed with breast cancer she created this amazing line of stamps and dies calledÂ Calling all SistahsÂ to create breast cancer awareness. In addition, fifty percent of the profits from this line goes to National Breast Cancer Foundation, Inc. for research and medical help. Isn’t that amazing and so so wonderful!! In addition to her line, she also created a monthly blog hop to support breast cancer awareness. And thisÂ hop is your friendly monthly reminder to check yourself, do your monthly self-exams and get your yearly mammograms. ðŸ™‚

And what is a blog hop without PRIZES!! Three lucky commentorsÂ who comment along the hop will win a $15 gift certificate! Comments close on May 19th @ 11:59 pm EST

And without further ado here’s my card.

First, I stamped the beautiful ribbon from the Hope Ribbon set in a gradation of pink inks repeatedly but flipping the ribbon alternately on a 5″ by 7″ panel of dark pink cardstock. I then stamped my sentiment, which is from Calling All Sistahs set, in embossing ink and embossed it in silver. To help it pop a little more I used my grey copic marker to create a shadow under the words.Isn’t it a great sentiment!! Michelle comes up withÂ the best sentiments. I then mounted my panel to my pink card base and she’s finished!And here’s an inside shot. This sentiment is again created from the Calling all Sistahs set. I also silver embossed it and addedÂ a shadow with my copic marker. I hope you enjoyed and continue along our hop, next up is the super talented Lisa Harrolle, and don’t forget to check yourself!

 

CAS-ual Fridays Stamps

Archana Bhurke

Nora Noll

Susan White

Bonnie Sharp

Lori Kobular

Diane Jaquay

Jeanne Jachna

Channin PelletierÂ <<You are here>>

Heather North

post_text:
Hello everyone!! I’m so excited to share with you my first card for CAS-ual Fridays’ Challenge as a challenge team member!! 

I hope you play along with us, CAS-ual Fridays is giving away a $25 certificate and they’ll double it if you use CAS-ual Fridays Stamps!

First, I created my candles by rolling 6″ by 2 1/2″ strips of copy paper (cardstock doesn’t work, too thick) and gluing the end down to secure them. I felt like I was rolling cigarettes, of course, I never done this before but that is sure what they looked like. I then ink blended on my candles in different shades of purples and pink. Next, I created the flames using the CFS set, Wallflower. I stamped the largest flower in the set on yellow cardstock with orange ink them fussy cut out the individual petals.

 I then created the background panel by blending my some of my purple and pink inks on the center of a 5″ x 7″ panel of white cardstock. Next, I stamped some of he flowers from the CFS new set, Pretty Posies, in a light purple over where I blended. It’s very faint and covered by the candles so it’s alittle hard to see. I then sprinkled on some water and blotted it up with a paper towel. Next, I stamped my sentiment which is from CFS’ Shenanigans set, in an yellow-orange gradation by inking the entire stamp in yellow then rolling the lower half on my orange ink pad. Lastly, I adhered the candles and flames to my panel, added wicks with a marker, and then went stickles crazy and added glitter to the flames and created and glitter ombre at the base of the candles with just little dots of the stickles. I hope you enjoyed my card and were inspired to participate in the challenge. Thanks for stopping by!

Share this:

  • Share
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Email

post_title: Make it Monday #247 and CAS(E) this Sketch #170
post_text:
Hello!! I’m here with a card to share for Papertrey Ink’s MIM Challenge #247 and for the CAS(E) this Sketch Challenge. 

Melissa at PTI shared a really neat watercoloring technique in her video and I had to give it a try, and who could resist CAS(E)’s  current sketch.


So here’s what I came up with.


I stamped and masked flowers and leaves from PTI’s In Bloom set on watercolored paper in versafine onyx black. I then blended red, violet, and green inks over my images. Then with a water brush, I brushed water over my blended areas to create a watercolored look. I then went in with more color to add detail and depth. After that I splattered black watercolor paint over the panel. 


I then cut my panel into four sections and watercolored the cut edges where the image was cut (this really made the cut look clean and finished). Next, I mounted my sections on craft foam and then adhered them onto my black card base. After that I stamped my PTI sentiment and added some black enamel dots. I hope you enjoyed, thanks for stopping by!

Share this:

cleaned_post_text: Hello!! I’m here with a card to share forPapertrey Ink’s MIM Challenge #247and for theCAS(E) this Sketch Challenge.Melissa at PTI shared a really neat watercoloring technique in her video and I had to give it a try, and who could resist CAS(E)’s  current sketch.So here’s what I came up with.I stamped and masked flowers and leaves from PTI’s In Bloom set on watercolored paper in versafine onyx black. I then blended red, violet, and green inks over my images. Then with a water brush, I brushed water over my blended areas to create a watercolored look. I then went in with more color to add detail and depth. After that I splattered black watercolor paint over the panel.I then cut my panel into four sections and watercolored the cut edges where the image was cut (this really made the cut look clean and finished). Next, I mounted my sections on craft foam and then adhered them onto my black card base. After that I stamped my PTI sentiment and added some black enamel dots. I hope you enjoyed, thanks for stopping by!Share this:ShareFacebookTwitterEmailLike this:LikeLoading...Related

post_title: CAS(E) this Sketch and ColourQ Challenge
post_text:
Hello! I have a card to share with you all!! I made this card for the CAS(E) this Sketch #168 Challenge and ColourQ Challenge #337. And without further ado here’s the card.  First, I stamped the large flower from CAS-ual Fridays Stamp, Wonderful Words four times in grey ink then clear embossed on watercolor paper. Then I watercolored the flowers with blue, pink, and yellow ink and fussy cut then out when they were dry. Next, I cut the frame from white cardstock and mounted it on foam tape. Then, on a 5″ by 7″ panel of white cardstock I stamped the chevrons which are also from CAS-ual Fridays Stamps, Zigs and Zags in the same yellow I used on the flower, but I had to do generation stamping because it was just a little too intense. I then stamped my sentiment from Papertrey Ink in grey and embossed it in clear.  

 Of course I thought it just wasn’t bold enough so I stamped the sentiment again in grey but slightly askew. Next, I blended pink ink and alittle yellow along left side of the card. Then, I sprinkled a little water to create a little variation to the gradation but it did pick up much ink so it’s very faint. Lastly, I glued my panel to the card case, along with the flowers, frame, and sequins! I had fun creating this card, I hope you enjoyed!

   
 

Share this:

  • Share
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Email

post_text:
Hello! I have another card for the Altenew’s February Challenge to share with you today. Here’s the inspiration photo,  

 Great colors, huh! And here’s my second attempt.  

 I stamped flowers from Altenew’s magnolias for Her set, embossed them in gold on watercolor paper. I then watercolored around them in Aqua blues to create a background. After it was dry, I went back with a slightly darker shade of blue to create a shadow by the flowers to create some depth. Then I water colored the center of the flowers with just a little golden yellow.  

 Next, I created the frame by cutting the frame out of black cardstock using my cricut and then stamped and embossing a flourish in gold. I then stamped and embossed in gold my sentiment on vellum and then colored behind the letters with a black marker to help them pop. I hope you enjoyed!!

Share this:

  • Share
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Email

post_text:
Hello! Here to share with you my creation for the latest Papertrey Ink’s MIM Challenge – Motif Building. This week Betsy shared with us a fantastic technique. It looked like lots of fun and a unique way to use your stamps. Here’s her beautiful creation. 

 She is definitely the master of motifs. Here’s feeble my attempt.  

 I played with the arrangement of these stamps far far too long and settled on this. I inked up the center snowflake in Hero Arts Tide Pool then added Evergreen Bough Distress Ink to the edges. I then stamped the Hero Arts snowman around the snowflake in versafine black onyx ink. I stamped additional Hero Arts snowflakes in around and a tiny candy cane in red. 

 I then colored the snowmen with markers. Lastly I stamped the PTI sentiment from Snow Flurries Set in versafine black onyx and embossed it in clear. I rounded one corner and tied some red baker’s twine to the top and called it done! I hope you enjoyed!

Share this:

  • Share
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Email

post_text:
Hello! It’s been a while. I received a custom order so I’ve been busy making ceramic vases and dishes to fill the kiln. In addition my sweet girl had a birthday (she turned 3) and our house goes a little crazy for themed parties. She wanted an Alice in Wonderland party and with a theme as fantastic as that I had to do it justice, so it took me about a week to make all the decorations. So Monday I finally found some time to get back to my card making. I was inspired by Papertrey Ink’s MIM Challenge – Stamped Stripes. Laurie’s video and examples were wonderful I had to play along.  

 First I stamped the butterfly in versa fine black onyx ink and embossed in clear so I wouldn’t lose any of the intensity of the black. Then I blended memento inks, tangelo, rose bud, and lilac posies, on top of the butterfly.  Then I fussy cut it out and glued some craft foam to the back.

 Next I blended my three inks again on a 5″ by 7″ piece of white cardstock. Then I stamped my stripes on top and the sentiment from PTI with versa fine black onyx ink. I hope you enjoy!

 
 

Share this:

  • Share
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Email

post_text:
Okay, this might be a little lame to enter an old Valentine’s Day card that I made for my husband, but I’m really proud of it. ðŸ™‚
Plus I liked how I used the ribbon. I used the “Accent Essentials” to cut out all the embellishments. I really like the 60s vibe it has.

Why a trailer? Well to celebrate, we stayed at this amazing place called the Shady Dell. It has refurbished vintage trailers that you stay in, it is the coolest place I have ever stayed. I made the trailer by cutting a bus from the “Potpourri” cartridge and then tweaked it a little cause I didn’t have a trailer cut.
